title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 15 June 2015 - XWiki
content:

10:08 <Pbas> has joined #xwiki  
10:13 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
10:13 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:39 <Enygma`> has quit  
10:39 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:41 <gdelhumeau> Hi  
10:41 <gdelhumeau> I've made a mistake  
10:41 <vmassol> hi  
10:41 <gdelhumeau> I wanted to cherry-pick a commit on the stable-7.1.x branch  
10:42 <gdelhumeau> so I've done git checkout -b stable-7.1.x  
10:42 <gdelhumeau> which was a mistake :(  
10:42 <evalica> just rollback …. we will want anyway for the ci to pass  
10:42 <gdelhumeau> because it created the branch from mastert  
10:42 <gdelhumeau> so I need to rollback the whole thing  
10:43 <Enygma`> gdelhumeau: 21 commits  
10:43 <gdelhumeau> indeed  
10:44 <cjd> 10:39 < gdelhumeau> so I've done git checkout -b stable-7.1.x  <-- that trashes the original version and creates a new one ?  
10:44 <gdelhumeau> I did not have the branch locally  
10:44 <cjd> ahh ok  
10:44 <gdelhumeau> it was origin/stable-7.1.x  
10:45 <cjd> git checkout master && git branch -D stable-7.1.x  
10:45 <cjd> && git checkout stable-7.1.x  
10:45 <cjd> should do it  
10:45 <gdelhumeau> I've pushed this thing  
10:45 <gdelhumeau> I've found the fix  
10:45 <cjd> oh oops XD  
10:45 <cjd> probably best to force-push a git reset  
10:46 <cjd> be careful though, push -f will let you do most anything so double check your command  
10:48 <gdelhumeau> it's have been pulled by several person already I guess  
10:48 <gdelhumeau> at least jira and ci.xwiki.org  
10:48 <gdelhumeau> I can either send the 20 rollbacks  
10:48 <gdelhumeau> which is good for jira because it will know that the commits are rollbacked  
10:49 <gdelhumeau> or create a unique commit that revert the 20 bad  
10:49 <cjd> myeah, chance of jira or ci just blowing up and failing if you forceback  
10:50 <cjd> it's supposed to pull forcepushes unless you tell it not to, however I can imagine like JIRA's logic just running off into a null pointer or something because "nobody thought of that"  
10:50 <gdelhumeau> it's because when you look at the "commits" section of a jira issue  
10:50 <cjd> /nod  
10:50 <gdelhumeau> I want people to see that the bad commit has been reverted  
10:51 <cjd> ideally a forcepush would make it disappear  
10:51 <cjd> worst case it would corrupt jira's db  
10:51 <gdelhumeau> I don't think it works like this  
10:51 <gdelhumeau> jira has an event system AFAIK  
10:52 <gdelhumeau> so we need an event that delete the previous commit  
10:52 <gdelhumeau> somethign liek tthat  
10:52 <gdelhumeau> not just a --force  
10:53 <gdelhumeau> let's push everything, for the jira reason  
10:53 <gdelhumeau> sorry for this  
11:05 <gdelhumeau> fixed  
11:05 <gdelhumeau> sorry for that  
11:33 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:50 <gsmeria> has quit  
11:50 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki

12:13 <lucaa> has quit  
12:28 <Enygma`> gdelhumeau: there were 21 commits  
12:28 <gdelhumeau> the last one is good :)  
12:28 <Enygma`> 1 was yours, so there should have been 20 rollbacks  
12:28 <Enygma`> not 19  
12:28 <gdelhumeau> it's the cherry-pick  
12:28 <Enygma`> you missed 1  
12:29 <Enygma`> gdelhumeau: did you rollback https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/6f68607cb5a261d4413dc4ba7a5a06c6d26b776e ?  
12:29 <gdelhumeau> I did git revert 6f68607cb5a261d4413dc4ba7a5a06c6d26b776e..477c5888a6572d436fea48d3c22314e4d24cf2b  
12:30 <Enygma`> looking at https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blame/master/xwiki-platform-core/pom.xml#L28 seems you`ve missed that one  
12:30 <gdelhumeau> I see  
12:30 <gdelhumeau> so git revert a..b don't really work  
12:30 <gdelhumeau> as expected

16:21 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
16:26 <msmeria> has quit  
16:30 <evalica> starting 7.1 release  
16:31 <Pbas> Hello everyone, I have a Class with properties and I want to get type of property (specially Date and Boolean). Do you know if i can do that with velocity whit something like: $MyObject.getProperty($prop.Name)??.type ??  
16:31 <Pbas> I didn't find it in nice new doc: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ScriptingDocumentation  
16:32 <Pbas> then I don't know if you provide a method for this.  
16:32 <Pbas> Thxs for some tips:)  
16:34 <Pbas>  $MyObject.getProperty($prop.Name).value return the property value and I want "data" type...  
16:35 <evalica> .class? I don't know  
16:35 <evalica> :p  
16:37 <Pbas> nope :-)  
16:47 <Enygma`> Pbas: $object.xWikiClass.get('<propertyName>').classType  
16:48 <Enygma`> on an XWikiUsers object $object.xWikiClass.get('first\_name').classType returns String  
16:50 <Pbas> Yes !!! :)  
16:50 <Pbas> That's it!  
16:50 <Enygma`> :)  
16:51 <Pbas>  $MonObj.xWikiClass.get($prop.Name).classType  return Date, Boolean, etc.  
16:51 <Pbas> Thxs a lot  
16:53 <lucaa> has quit  
16:54 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
16:55 <vmassol> question from twitter: "https://twitter.com/vmassol/ https://twitter.com/xwikiorg/  is there an updated tool to migrate from jspwiki to xwiki ? Thank you."  
16:57 <tmortagne> all I know is http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/JSPWiki+To+XWiki+Conversion  
17:05 <vmassol> yes me too  
17:05 <vmassol> but I don't think it works  
17:05 <vmassol> actually I know it doesn't  
17:05 <vmassol> I replied to someone who tried to use it on the list

20:30 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
20:33 <cjd> has quit  
20:34 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
20:41 <eromano> Hi.  I've got a multi-subwiki system plugged into an LDAP server for registration. All subwikis use global users only (selected Use Global Users Only at creation). Why is it that when given a link to a specific subwiki, when a user authenticates, it creates a new local (or so it seems)?  
20:42 <vmassol> eromano: sorry, I can't help you on that, I don't know how the LDAP works but did you check the LDAP settings?  
20:43 <vmassol> did you check the mailing list archives, I'm sure there's some info there  
20:44 <vmassol> http://xwiki.markmail.org/search/?q=LDAP  
20:46 <eromano> I'll keep looking. Also, got a 500 error on searching the mail archive O.o  
20:48 <Slashman> has quit  
20:59 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
21:00 <eromano> I think I found a workaround.  When the docs say  to go to the  XWiki.XWikiPreference page object and modify a field, where is this exactly?  
21:07 <vmassol> eromano: you have a link to the doc?  
21:10 <eromano> @vmassol: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/LDAPAuthenticationUseCases#HApproach1:Configuregroupmembershiplogin  
21:10 <eromano> Under "I'm in a multiwiki environment and I want my LDAP users to register only on the main wiki"  
21:11 <eromano> I know how to get to the object editor of the main wiki via the direct url, but not for a subwiki  
21:13 <vmassol> updating page  
21:17 <cjd> has quit  
21:22 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
21:23 <vmassol> eromano: please check the page again :)  
21:23 <vmassol> I hope it's easier now, let me know!  
21:25 <vmassol> fixing link  
21:26 <vmassol> trying to understans why my anchor don't work ;)  
21:30 <eromano> I'm going to sound dumb here... but  is the XWiki.XWikiPreferences page for a subwiki the same page as the "Administer Wiki" page?  
21:30 <vmassol> yes  
21:31 <vmassol> guys, can anyone see why the anchors don't work for http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/FAQ/How+can+I+navigate+to+a+given+page ?  
21:32 <eromano> Probably something I'm doing wrong, but I can't edit that page in objects mode. And I'm logged in as admin  
21:37 <eromano> (no edit drop-down, hotkey doesn't pop up the page)  
21:38 <vmassol> ctrl+g  
21:41 <eromano> Only pages that come up are XWiki macro pages and the syntax page. (Searching for XWiki.XWikiPreferences)  
21:41 <eromano> (sorry for the trouble)  
21:46 <eromano> I figured it out via direct urls... I had "admin" in the url instead of "edit"  
21:47 <vmassol> eromano: did you read my link?  
21:47 <vmassol> here: http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/FAQ/How+can+I+navigate+to+a+given+page  
21:52 <eromano> Yeah, third bullet worked once I found out why my url was wrong. Couldn't get the search to find the page I was looking for with bullet 1. Thanks  
21:52 <vmassol> eromano: the first one works roo!!!  
21:52 <vmassol> \*too  
21:52 <vmassol> but maybe you missed the last paragraph!  
21:53 <vmassol> I can't do much more to help though :)  
21:53 <vmassol> can you confirm that you turned on hidden docs?  
21:55 <mflorea1> has quit  
21:57 <eromano> Yeah, Admin seems to have hidden docs on by default. Sorry, juggling fires. We were blindsided by a sudden wiki migration, and I'm learning as I go...  
21:58 <eromano> The go-to page search looks under the current wiki as context, right?  
21:58 <vmassol> yes  
21:58 <Enygma`> has quit  
21:59 <eromano> Yeah, only brings up those two pages as suggestions while looking for XWikiPreferences.  
21:59 <vmassol> testing on playground.xwiki.org  
21:59 <vmassol> works fine :)  
22:00 <vmassol> eromano: you turned on hidden pages right?  
22:00 <eromano> For the current user? Yes. What did you search for?  
22:01 <vmassol> "XWikiP"  
22:02 <eromano> Oh, I'm probably not seeing hidden docs on the playground without registering.  
22:02 <vmassol> on playground no but on your wiki you should....  
22:03 <eromano> Yeah, it brings it up from playground. Not from my wiki. No idea.  
22:05 <eromano> Oh. Whoops. Silly user mistake.  
22:05 <vmassol> :)  
22:05 <vmassol> hidden docs were not visible right?  
22:07 <eromano> Yeah. I'm logged onto three different users, and the one I was searching on I forgot to save preferences.  
22:07 <vmassol> ok  
22:25 <eromano> Hmmm. So something I had set up globally for LDAP is the timeout field. I needed slightly higher than 1000ms because we run our servers on potatoes.  
22:25 <eromano> However, that configuration option isn't in the object editor.  
22:26 <eromano> Will it take the configuration option for each subwiki from the config file?  
22:29 <vmassol> I don't know, I really don't know anything about LDAP sorry  
22:36 <evalica> has quit  
22:41 <vmassol> has quit  
22:57 <eromano> has quit
